definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to be able to plan victory from a thousand miles away (idiom)
a general planning in the seclusion of his tent is able to determine the outcome of the distant battle (idiom)
pinyin: yun4 chou2 wei2 wo4 zhi1 zhong1 , jue2 sheng4 qian1 li3 zhi1 wai4
containing_words.word: 運籌帷幄之中，決勝千里之外

sentences.english: The two armies converge on the enemy capital for the last battle of the war.
sentences.chinese: 兩軍聚集在敵方首都，準備一決勝負。

sentences.english: Then the final showdown with the bad kung fu kids.
sentences.chinese: 然後結局定會和反派功夫小子一決勝負。

sentences.english: Russia is mobilizing its troops for another showdown with Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯正在調兵遣將，要與格魯吉亞再決勝負。

sentences.english: I'll break a lance with you in argument.
sentences.chinese: 我要和你辯論，一決勝負。

sentences.english: But our number one recovered in the second set to level the match and take it into a decider .
sentences.chinese: 但我們的頭號選手扳回了第二盤，將比賽帶入決勝盤。

sentences.english: Want to play me in basketball?
sentences.chinese: 要跟我打籃球一決勝負嗎？

sentences.english: The top teams will play off seven games against each other.
sentences.chinese: 優勝隊之間相互要打七場比賽以決勝負。

sentences.english: Just as we were entering the homestretch, another of our leaders was gone.
sentences.chinese: 我們剛剛進入決勝跑道，就又失去了一個領導人。

sentences.english: There has been a tendency for adopting the advantage set in the final of tennis men's singles.
sentences.chinese: 網球男單比賽決勝盤採用長盤賽制已成爲一種趨勢。

sentences.english: I sincerely welcome your company's arrival will help you devised strategies Out of a thousand miles.
sentences.chinese: 我公司真誠歡迎您的到來，將幫你運籌帷幄決勝千里。

sentences.english: We never planned to have a showdown with anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我們從沒想到過要和任何人一決勝負。

sentences.english: After years of waiting, these two bitter rivals are finally poised for the ultimate showdown.
sentences.chinese: 等待數年之後，兩軍終於準備好一決勝負。

sentences.english: The head of Liberia's election commission has said that the run-off vote will go ahead as planned.
sentences.chinese: 利比里亞選舉委員會主席稱，決勝選舉將如期舉行。

sentences.english: Michael Jordan's last-second game-winning shot was spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 喬丹最後一秒那決勝的投射真是太美妙了。

sentences.english: Both candidates have expressed confidence in their showing.
sentences.chinese: 兩位決勝選舉候選人都公開展示了對這次選舉的信心。

definition: victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
